metadata.dc:author: Jiménez, R
Mora, L A
Moya, C
Apéstegui, A
Jiménez, E
metadata.dc:description: The laboratory tests used to establish the diagnosis of infection in the newborn period were studied and it was found that more than 700 band cells/mm3 in peripheral blood supported the diagnosis of sepsis and that concomitant thrombocytopenia increased these possibilities. Among the other tests, only the IgM was found of diagnostic value in cases of intrauterine infection.
metadata.dc:title: El diagnóstico de infección en el período neonatal.
[The diagnosis of infection in the neonatal period].
metadata.dc:publisher: Boletin medico del Hospital Infantil de Mexico
